reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I loved this book
reviews.reviewText: It took me a little bit to get into it, which is weird because I love Greek mythology books. But after they were old enough and the gods 'conned' psyche into a marriage, it was worth the read. Everything was very Greek mythesque, tragedy, love, it was well written. 5/5 Amazon/Goodreads/fable!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Oh my mythology heart
reviews.reviewText: I’m in love with the characters! I love mythology and books about the colorful characters. Parts could of been better but overall loved it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to love this but the first-person narrative felt at once too flip, and too distant. Tell, not show. I didn't hate it, but I never felt embedded in ancient Greek culture, and the language wasn't lyrical enough to make up for the lack of a sense of place.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Book was packaged amazingly so book was not damaged and it’s a great read highly recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars really loved this one!
reviews.reviewText: I am a sucker for good mythology, and though I can’t speak to any serious accuracy or anything, I enjoyed the adventure and love of this one. It’s one I could see coming back to again and again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I loved this book, fight me on it
reviews.reviewText: I do NOT understand the Greek myth gatekeepers that keep bashing this book. I thought this was a wonderful retelling and reimagining of the Psyche and Eros myth. Psyche was badass, Eros was a hilarious idiot, and the two of them together was *chef's kiss*. Two stubborn, naive, and powerful individuals overcome their own biases, the world's expectations, and fall in love with each other at the same time?Sounds like my kind of romance! (Sorry but I'm a Jane Austin girl at heart!) I don't even really like most modern romances and I am giving this a 10/10. But if you like to complain about "not being true to the source material," then I suggest you skip it and save everyone the trouble.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Decent writing, needed more detail
reviews.reviewText: Overall, the book was good. Pretty easy read. I’m not a wiz on Greek mythology, so the addition of background on the gods as they were introduced was helpful. Psyche, as I imagine, is supposed to be this badass fighter and survivor… I felt the story lacked portraying that, or at least lacked detail in that category. I understand it is firstly a romance novel, but it didn’t have the great and intense detail of fights and creatures slain that it could have had. Her first monster fight victory was described in less than a page. I know she wasn’t going to have a “Hercules hero montage” but her greatness in fighting monsters that she was supposed to have (at least in the beginning) was relatively boring and underwhelming.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast and sweet
reviews.reviewText: A simple, sweet retelling of the greek myth. Enjoyed every chapter. It is a very fast paced (a plus for me) and easy to read. Good for when you just want to unwind
This book takes you to a beautiful fantasy land.I never enjoyed a book so much in my lifeSo romantic !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I've always wanted to read a Psyche and Eros retelling, since I fell in love with the myth when I was younger. It is honestly one of my favourite myths.I thought that this was a great retelling and couldn't put this book down.A great feminist take on this classic myth. Blended with the stories of a few other heroes and gods. I loved the romance, the adventure and the stakes shown in this story. A must read Greek myth retelling 🏺🏛

reviews.reviewTitle: Psyche and Eros: The spellbinding and hotly-anticipated Greek mythology retelling that every...
reviews.reviewText: Je n'ai pas lu ce livre d'amour en anglais. Je le destine à ma petite-fille âgée de 17 ans, qui a étudié l'anglais à l'école primaire, puis au collège et au lycée. Elle est en terminale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was fun to read and I was totally gripped, however if you do not like a Greek mythology retelling that differs from the original myths, this may not be for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed the book ( read it until gone 1am just to finish it )Looking forward to any new books the author brings out if there similar
